title: The Hen That Laid the Golden Egg = La Poule Aux Oeufs D'or [The Corrick Collection]
other_title: The Hen That Laid the Golden Egg/La Poule Aux Oeufs D'or : Corrick Collection # 39
subject_group: Literature/Fairy tales - Film and video adaptations
abstract: A silent hand coloured film based on a fable by La Fontaine of wealth and greed told in four acts: 'The Conjurer’s Lottery', 'The Fantastic Fowls House', 'Ephemeral Fortune' and 'The Miser’s Fate'.
description: Although the Corricks were not likely aware of it, their collection contains a number of films featuring the handiwork of one cinema’s earliest and most innovative special effects artists (Segundo de Chomón) who used dyes applied by hand which demonstrates colourisation in early film.  At least eleven films from Chomon's stint at Pathé were purchased by the Corrick Family including this fantastic colour extravaganza. This silent hand coloured film is based on a fable by La Fontaine of wealth and greed told in four acts: 'The Conjurer’s Lottery', 'The Fantastic Fowls House', 'Ephemeral Fortune' and 'The Miser’s Fate'.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002470; Presenting the Corrick Collection; Active; 2011
